title: SHAP values and influential features different with Kernelexplainer and tree explainer
body:
Hi,

I tried using shap kernel explainer and shap tree explainer on a sample from Census income classification dataset. I trained using GradientBoostingClassifier.

I got different explanations with the kernel and tree explainers:

Kernel explainer: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44719871/48050978-b4098900-e1c9-11e8-8859-4f689b4914c9.png)

kernel shap_values for the  record: [ 0.53197299,  0.0154611 , -0.09542535,  0.0010581 , -0.39101478,
       -1.05349858,  0.01213471, -0.25418667, -0.1641437 , -0.05299885,
       -0.04145205, -0.03402004]

Tree explainer:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44719871/48051004-c97eb300-e1c9-11e8-8661-829ac0fe7af4.png)

tree shap_values for the  record: [ 0.00555308,  0.        ,  0.        ,  0.        ,  0.        ,
        0.        ,  0.        , -0.01521528,  0.        ,  0.        ,
        0.        , -0.00178008]


From the above, the explanations when using different explainers are  not consistent. I want to understand which explainer to use.
